creator: peterj@liberate.com
text:
Recent CVS changes to the jar task have made it always rebuild jar files, even
if none of the source has changed.  I suspect this is related to revision 1.19
and later where manifest handling was changed; if a manifest is not specified,
is it affecting the timestamp comparisons on the other files?
Can you add in the snippet of your jar command and I'll have a look
creator: conor@apache.org
rubys@us.ibm.com
text:
I see this too.  Excerpt from xml-axis/java/build.xml:

    <jar jarfile="${build.lib}/${name}.jar" basedir="${build.dest}" >
      <include name="org/**" />
    </jar>

creator: peterj@liberate.com
text:
Mine's not much different from Sam's, except I don't use a fileset:

<property name="built.jar" value="built/jar"/>
<property name="built.classes" value="built/classes"/>
<jar
	jarfile="${built.jar}/qa.jar"
	basedir="${built.classes}"
	includes="com/**/*.class"
/>
